thread.title: Harrison Ford lands illegally while piloting private plane
thread.title_full: Harrison Ford lands illegally while piloting private plane

author: KATE FELDMAN
title: Harrison Ford lands illegally while piloting private plane
text:
Harrison Ford lands illegally while piloting private plane, under investigation by FAA: report Harrison Ford lands illegally while piloting private plane Harrison Ford attempted to land on a runway at John Wayne Airport in Orange County, but instead piloted his way onto a taxiway Monday afternoon. (Richard Shotwell/Richard Shotwell/Invision/AP) Tuesday, February 14, 2017, 5:13 PM 
Harrison Ford reportedly landed illegally at a California airport while flying his private plane Monday. 
The actor attempted to land on a runway at John Wayne Airport in Orange County, but instead piloted his way onto a taxiway, according to NBC Nightly News . 
The Federal Aviation Administration confirmed to the Daily News that it is investigating a single-engine Aviat Husky that landed on a taxiway Monday afternoon, but would not identify anyone involved. 
While trying to land, Ford flew over a fully loaded American Airlines 737 carrying 110 passengers and six crew members, according to NBC . A look back at Harrison Ford's action-packed life and career 
The flight, which was headed to Dallas-Fort Worth, was reportedly able to depart safely. 
The FAA told The News that the pilot of the single-engine plane had correctly read back instructions from air traffic controllers before the mishap. 
The 74-year-old actor was heard on a recording asking “Was that airliner meant to be underneath me?” according to NBC . In March 2015, the “Indiana Jones” actor reported engine failure while flying his vintage World War II plane in Los Angeles and was forced to make a crash landing on a Santa Monica golf course. (LUCY NICHOLSON/REUTERS)
